title: Where to find a buy-to-let bargain for less than £65,000
text:
House prices are falling in many areas of the country – but high purchase costs can still be a deterrent to buy-to-let investors looking to expand their portfolios.

Landlords have often looked to towns and cities in the north of England, as well as Scotland and Wales, for better value.

However, with cities such as Leeds and Manchester growing in popularity, it has become much harder to find a bargain property.

An analysis by One & Only, a property investment portal, looked at areas of England and Wales which have low house prices but comparatively high rents.

It found 10 locations where buy-to-let properties could be purchased for less than £65,000 but are expected to rise because they are under-priced...
description: House prices are falling in many areas of the country – but high purchase costs can still be a deterrent to buy-to-let investors looking to expand their portfolios.
